wms_article_body.body: South Korean tobacco maker KT&G Corp. said on Tuesday it has introduced a master craftsman system for the first time and appointed three employees as its inaugural master craftsmen. At a ceremony at its headquarters, KT&G named Cho Young-il, team leader in cigarette machinery, Shin Dong-guk, group leader in packaging machinery, and Kang Tae-hoon, team leader in electronics and systems, to the role. The company said they are master artisans with extensive field experience and expertise, who will serve as key figures in passing down technical know-how and training younger engineers. KT&G added that the initiative is to improve manufacturing efficiency through process innovation, adoption of new technologies, and technical research.
